Breeding adult.description: Horned Grebes in breeding plumage have a chestnut neck and golden head tufts that run in a line along the head, rather than Eared Grebe's black neck and fan-shaped splay of feathers.

Nonbreeding.description: Horned Grebes in nonbreeding plumage have a sharp border between the black crown and white cheek. At close range, they have a white tip to the bill whereas Eared Grebe's bill is all dark.

Breeding adult.description: Red-necked Grebes are larger with longer, stouter bills than Eared Grebes. In breeding plumage they have a white cheek and red neck, unlike Eared's black neck and head.

Nonbreeding.description: Red-necked Grebes are larger and longer necked than Eared Grebes, with a larger bill that is yellowish. In nonbreeding plumage Red-necked has a clean white cheek without the dark ear patch of Eared.

Breeding.description: Pied-billed Grebes are smaller than Eared Grebes with a shorter neck and a thicker, stubbier bill.
